title: Catoctin Mountain Park: Park Home
body: Second Growth Forests Provide New Opportunities  President Franklin D. Roosevelt created programs to give people a chance to rebuild their lives from the Great Depression. The Works Progress Administration and the Civilian Conservation Corps gave this land a second opportunity and through re-growth, a new role as a recreation area. Read More             Visitor Center   Visitors are encouraged to begin their visit at the visitor center where maps and restrooms are available.            Hiking Trails   The park maintains 25 miles of hiking trails with difficulty ratings between easy and strenuous.          Camping and Lodging   You can rent a historic wooden cabin or camp under the stars.              Wildflowers   Explore the beauty of Catoctin's Spring Blooms        August 13 Trail Rehabilitation Workshop   Help replace water bars and improve overall conditions on a trail section leading to one of the most scenic overlook areas in the park.              August 27th Centennial Extravaganza    Join Catoctin Mountain Park and the Catoctin Forest Alliance in celebrating the 100th birthday of the NPS!        Salamander Safari August 13 at 5:00PM   Join us at the Owens Creek Campground Amphitheater to begin an on-hands search for the salamanders that live in Owens Creek.
